Description: Lower body sherd of Chian pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior glazed streaky brown with two faded added white bands; exterior: two brown bands; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ5
Curator's comments: Φ5 is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic elements and the absence of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces make it difficult to ascertain to what group this sherd belongs. The brown bands on the lower body are consistent with most Chian styles. The thinness of the sherd however, suggests that it comes from a later example in the series, perhaps a Chalice Style or Black Figure Komast or Animal chalice.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1231) (phase 2)
